The journey will be ever-changing as the possibilities of Web3 continue to expand exponentially but one thing is clear‚Ä¶ Legacy brands should begin their adventure and be humble in their approach as old playbooks are burned. 7/7

With the coming maturation of Web3 technologies, and experiences those who do will be positioned to welcome mainstream consumers who would (in success) continue to affix their loyalty to them over a native Web3 upstart with similar product.¬†6/7
As with any major technological shift, we'll likely be starting with consumers who are Web3 aficionados¬†and early evangelists¬†as brands shape their role in the¬†metaverse. 5/7
Brands have the opportunity to begin building the scaffolding¬†for a Minimum Viable Community. Developing a roadmap to grow that into a thriving Web3 community of brand evangelists. 4/7
Within that shift, brand loyalty¬†is likely to accrue to those who provide the best Return on Time (as a measure of factors both tangible and intangible such as sense of belonging).¬†3/7
As mainstream adoption unfolds over the decade, a gradual understanding of the social and economic power afforded by these incentive structures will occur. 2/7
Web3 is the great pivot toward a Community economy. A place where new mechanisms to interact, learn and earn will radically change how and why consumers support brands. 1/7

2/2 The burden on anyone building a Minimum Viable Community will be to establish and track ‚ÄúReturn on Time‚Äù as KPI. A measurement of both value provided and appreciation potential of community owned assets in correlation to their initial cost. @alexisohanian @balajis @cdixon

1/2 Thinking about scarcity of time and how the future of community as enabled by Web3 will lower the # of tribes any individual will be able to actively participate in.

How will they assess? 

One factor amongst many may be which provides a higher ‚ÄúReturn on Time‚Äù.

(6/6) Monetizing is first because in the Own/Earn world your community participation = your job. Ideally it‚Äôs aligned with passions.

Web2 - monetization = transaction 
Web3 - monetization = investment 

A definitional flip accelerating growth in an exponential age cc: @RaoulGMI
(5/6) If you see something you love in the above ‚Äî you jump in and ‚Äúmonetize‚Äù the community by choosing to seed invest with your time and light capital.
(4/6) Utility - What‚Äôs the roadmap? What is the larger idea that this community wants to solve? Can it scale (@Cooopahtroopa has a great thread on SubDAOs) https://t.co/1xa5MLQRjI

(3/6) Beauty - Is this IP aesthetically pleasing (If NFT is organizational asset)

Community - Does this seem to be attracting buzz in circles I self identify with?
(2/6) Community formation in Web3 is bootstrapped with monetization via formation. It‚Äôs a visceral response to an idea assessed via: beauty/community/utility.

(1/6) Thoughts re: Web3 ‚Äúmonetization first‚Äù. It‚Äôs not monetization in the traditional sense of transacting. You could say:

monetization first, transactions second 

Wherein engagement = comm. marketing to drive transaction ‚Äî they are the new/hyper efficient Conversion Machine https://t.co/ys5Oo7smle

@DavidSacks Jason on @theallinpod totally dismissing #Bitcoin Remittances, Store of Value, and Instant Final Settlement as saying ‚Äúwho needs it‚Äù and ‚ÄúPayPal does it‚Äù vs. DAOs as the holy grail (?!) his takes stay horrendous on BTC & crypto. DAOs will be powerful but yikes.

(13/13) and ultimately everyone will Earn together. This is the true unlock and promise of Web3. We‚Äôre now in a read/write/own world. Your consumers now choose to work for you and the upside is available to all. üöÄ

(12/13) The best brand builders post Web3 are going to be expert storytellers at crafting the Spark that drives people to come together... and then relentlessly add CommValue and IP Value -- which will naturally incentivize engagement and loyalty‚Ä¶

(11/13) As a brand builder you‚Äôre organizing and monetizing via the Spark and then engagement comes as a by-product of your decentralized work force following incentives to consume & promote. Right click delete on Web2 era commercialization.

(10/13) Let‚Äôs use @cdixon ‚Äôs mental model:

Web2 = engagement first, monetization second
Web3 = monetization first, engagement second

(9/13) As the product itself is scarce and likely to dwarf supply, it adds additional CommValue as others see the long tail appreciation of assets they could have been gifted as members of the Community. The idea of future scarce products will not escape consideration.
(8/13) This one:two punch realizes the community as an engagement army following an incentive structure to purchase, gift, and generally promote the product to themselves raise IP and CommValue.

(7/13) In a characteristically savvy move, @garyvee also added CommValue by gifting bottles of the premium wine to IP hodlers, setting the tone for continued perks and signaling that it‚Äôs lucrative to be within the VeeFriends walls.

(6/13) Gary added IP value by putting that character into the world, raising awareness of both it and umbrella brand, and establishing traits through association that will follow it to other mediums in time (ex: animation).

(5/13) IP Value is a secondary concern and currently focused on adding to desirability of the organizational assets (NFTs) that represent fractionalized ownership within the collective. Ex: @garyvee dropping empathy elephant wine.

(4/13) Continual accrual of Community Value not only rewards hodlers of associated IP and hardens loyalty but dials up external fervor as outsiders promote collective IP as a proxy for membership. This further dials up CommValue.

(3/13) Community value is seen through external desirability of the collective. Ex: Is it cool to be in the Bored Ape Yacht Club? Cost of entry rises accordingly to market assessment of that question. This will have second order impact on IP desirability as well.
(2/13) With a spark ‚Äî your job is to bring relentless focus to adding Community Value and IP Value. Two distinct concerns.

(1/13) It all starts with a spark. An idea that serves as a beacon to corral disparate individuals across the globe. Without a core thematic ‚Äî the initial signal may not be strong enough to break through and attract a community. A Minimum Viable Community is key to idea validity.
